sources.title: Thirty Seconds Over Tokyo (1944) Spencer Tracy · Van Johnson
sources.description: The fate of a US bomber crew during the planning and execution of the first air raid on Japan; the focus is on the conflicts of a severely wounded pilot.   A gripping war film that, without great artistic ambition, achieves a powerful effect with documentary meticulousness, good acting, and a patriotic pathos appropriate to the era.

metadata.Plot: The amazingly detailed true story of "The Doolittle Raid" based on the personal account by Doolittle Raider Ted Lawson. Stunned by Pearl Harbor and a string of defeats, America needed a victory - badly. To that end, Colonel Jimmy Doolittle, a former air racer and stunt pilot, devises a plan for a daring raid on the heart of Japan itself. To do this, he must train army bomber pilots to do something no one ever dreamed possible - launch 16 fully loaded bombers from an aircraft carrier! Remarkable in its accuracy, this movie even uses film footage from the actual raid.
metadata.Writer: Dalton Trumbo, Ted W. Lawson, Bob Considine
metadata.Actors: Spencer Tracy, Van Johnson, Robert Walker
